description: Let us know in the comments if you want more videos on famous Call of Duty actors!
title: MICHAEL KEATON Was In CALL OF DUTY?! 🤯

description:
This remaster of the 2002 canon sequel to John Carpenter’s 1982 horror classic The Thing features some of Nightdive’s most impressive visual upgrades to date. In addition to improved models, textures, and environments, new dynamic lighting, and 4K resolution at 144 FPS, we’ve worked with the original development team on an assortment of gameplay improvements. 

Notably, the advanced fear/trust interface where your influence on your team’s psychological state directly impacts whether or not they cooperate with you. Are you brave enough to join Cpt. J.F. Blake and his team as they investigate the chilling events that transpired at Outpost 31? Find out when The Thing: Remastered releases on PC and consoles later this year.
title: The Thing: Remastered - Official Gameplay Trailer

description:
Alexander Kriss is a clinical psychologist and author based in New York, and has written extensively about why we play games, and the effect games can have on their players. He's also a lifelong fan of the original Silent Hill 2, and has written about the game and its characters from the perspective of a psychologist.

Today he's breaking down some of the characters and themes from Silent Hill 2, and seeing how the 2024 remake stacks up against the 2001 original.

What does a psychologist think of how themes of trauma and grief are explored in Silent Hill 2, and what can the actions of James, Angela and Eddie tell us about the nature of Silent Hill?

What does Alex, a lifelong fan of the original Silent Hill 2, think of the 2024 remake and its reworked characters, cutscenes and art style?

00:00 Intro
01:10 What Video Games Can Teach Us
01:45 The Dreamlike Nature of Silent Hill 2
03:25 Opening Cutscene
04:06 Meeting Angela
04:48 Angela's Behaviour
06:34 "Lost?!"
07:48 James's Motivat
title: Psychologist Reacts to Silent Hill 2's Characters and Themes
